1604064963_mirrored_deavmi_github.body: If you just want to seed a folder, bittorent is your friend. If you only want to use the "torrent folder that can be changed" feature of ZeroNet and ignore the user interface and database features, someone could create a ZeroNet site for that without touching the core functionality. Or maybe this zite will solve your use-case: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GrtBsG57kjU2Z3iAQebG9D5c8CRDRLoPj/

1604065071_mirrored_HelloZeroNet_github.body: Great news! Is there a zite address you could share with us?

1604065145_mirrored_iShift_github.body: Backing up your private keys to an off-line storage or to paper should be easy for site administrators. If it is not possible to do it using the WebUI, it should be easy to do using the ZeroNet client user interface. [BIP39](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039.mediawiki) makes paper storage easy. We would need password authentication for accessing the private key (#384) as a prerequisite for this issue.

1604065298_mirrored_Igitzu_github.body: I have personally seen [Fiddler](http://www.telerik.com/fiddler) downgrading the protocol to HTTP 1.0. Maybe @Igitzu uses some web proxy similar to that tool?

1604065318_mirrored_wigy-opensource-deve.body: Recent versions start up quite fast. Great ux improvement!

1604065363_mirrored_62gs8ha_github.body: #354 is a more generic approach that might work not only with the blog, but with all zites. See also https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroAdmin/issues

1604065370_mirrored_dnelband_github.body: I can just confirm that `index.html` was not downloaded. I see you are using the 0.3.6 version of the client. Could you try updating that to 0.3.7 to see if that helps? Also, newer versions have an `inner_path` key in all `content.json` files. This is missing in your root `content.json`

I get the following in my node. How did you sign your site after the changes you made to it?

> [17:10:06] Site:159kok..cPei index.html file size does not match 16334 <> 14979, Hash: False
> [17:10:08] Site:159kok..cPei assets/css/style.css file size does not match 9305 <> 9241, Hash: False
> [17:10:10] Site:159kok..cPei app/modules/comments/directives/comment-list.directive.js file size does not match 1062 <> 603, Hash: False
> [17:10:11] Site:159kok..cPei app/modules/posts/directives/post-list.directive.js file size does not match 638 <> 454, Hash: False
> [17:10:13] Site:159kok..cPei data/comment.json file size does not match 1150 <> 850, Hash: False
> [17:10:14] Site:159kok..cPei data/users/1C1gnFcVv9J9kUjF4odDMRYcEWVPJbbqFp/post_vote.json file size does not match 147 <> 133, Hash: False
> [17:10:17] Site:159kok..cPei assets/less/style.less file size does not match 9719 <> 8649, Hash: False

If you are in doubt how to do it, [AceLewis](https://youtu.be/D-x9Ob7kktE?list=PLgFqcJDOq2q5orC1U4IvDBMpjezKt-X4E) created nice tutorial videos about ZeroNet

Today I am still seeing signature problems on the zite you made:

> [14:43:52] Site:159kok..cPei index.html file size does not match 16334 <> 14979, Hash: False

Did you loose interest or do you need more time or help?

1604065377_mirrored_mcl1234_github.body: I agree that this zite idea does not need support from the ZeroNet client itself. It is still a good idea for a zite. Maybe there should be a label for zite ideas on this project?

1604065446_mirrored_obv-mikhail_github.body: Initial page-load might be somewhat longer for a zite, but there is always a time-space trade-off. And since zites are single-page-applications, the initial page-load might not be the most relevant performance metric. Anyways, I see and accept your argument.

1604065461_mirrored_wigy-opensource-deve.body:

also I did this from the command prompt:

```
$ ping torrent.gresille.org
ping: unknown host torrent.gresille.org
```
The tracker is still unresolvable, but ZeroNet 0.4.1 r1523 does not spam the console, so the issue is fixed. Thanks.

topic.title: Startup takes 4 minutes on Ubuntu 15.10 wily
topic.body:
Starting up the Linux client always took a minute or two, but nowadays it takes around 4 minutes on my machine.

```
wigy@xxxx:~/bin/ZeroNet$ ./zeronet.py 
- Starting ZeroNet...
[14:06:04] - OpenSSL loaded, version: 01000204F
[14:06:04] - Version: 0.3.7 r1210, Python 2.7.10 (default, Oct 14 2015, 16:09:02) 
[GCC 5.2.1 20151010], Gevent: 1.1b1
[14:06:04] - Creating FileServer....
[14:06:04] TorManager Tor controller connect error: error: [Errno 111] Connection refused in TorManager.py line 154 > _socket2.py line 186
[14:06:04] - Creating UiServer....
[14:09:51] - Removing old SSL certs...
[14:09:51] - Starting servers....
[14:09:51] Ui.UiServer --------------------------------------
[14:09:51] Ui.UiServer Web interface: http://127.0.0.1:43110/
[14:09:51] Ui.UiServer --------------------------------------
[14:09:52] FileServer Checking port 15441 using portchecker.co...
[14:09:53] FileServer [OK :)] Port open: Port 15441 is open.
```

Has anyone experienced this on other systems as well? Any hints what might happen just before removing the old SSL certs?

topic.title: "Name or service not known" unhandled exception periodically pops up
topic.body:
I love the 0.4.1 update, the startup time really went down. Great!

I do not remember though getting these every few seconds in 0.3.x though on my Ubuntu MATE 15.10:

```
[16:49:39] - Unhandled exception
None
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gevent/threadpool.py", line 203, in _worker
    value = func(*args, **kwargs)
socket.gaierror: [Errno -2] Name or service not known
[16:49:43] - Unhandled exception
None
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gevent/threadpool.py", line 203, in _worker
    value = func(*args, **kwargs)
socket.gaierror: [Errno -2] Name or service not known
[16:49:47] - Unhandled exception
None
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gevent/threadpool.py", line 203, in _worker
    value = func(*args, **kwargs)
socket.gaierror: [Errno -2] Name or service not known
```

I do not have tor, but the port is opened.
